overview:
Bharath Madhusudan is a co-founder of Securly, an SF-Bay Area based stealth mode security startup.

Prior to Securly, Bharath was an architect at Huawei-Symantec where he led the design of their Application Firewall and Intrusion Prevention technologies. Before that, he spent several years as a security researcher in McAfee where he worked on the industry’s leading Intrusion Prevention solution. He has been named a co-inventor on 4 patents related to botnet detection in enterprise networks.

Bharath holds a MS in Computer Science from Washington University in St. Louis where his Masters thesis was a hardware system to detect fast-spreading worms. He also has a Bachelors degree from the University of Maryland.
